name: Whativebeenreading
body:
#March 2014
* [Circuit Breaker](http://martinfowler.com/bliki/CircuitBreaker.html)
* [SendGrid moving to Go](http://sendgrid.com/blog/convince-company-go-golang/)
* [10 things you should know about running mongodb at scale](http://highscalability.com/blog/2014/3/5/10-things-you-should-know-about-running-mongodb-at-scale.html)
* [Co Workers as Customers. Lessons from Airbnb and Etsy](https://speakerdeck.com/mrtazz/co-workers-as-customers-lessons-from-airbnb-and-etsy)
* [Are you leaving web performance on the table (IIS/gzip/Via header)](https://blogs.akamai.com/2014/03/are-you-leaving-web-performance-on-the-table.html)
* [Netty at Twitter with Finagle](https://blog.twitter.com/2014/netty-at-twitter-with-finagle)
* [Docker dynamic ambassador powered by Etcd](http://coreos.com/blog/docker-dynamic-ambassador-powered-by-etcd/)
* [Engineer Recruiting](http://www.infoq.com/presentations/engineer-recruiting)

###February 2014
* [Big O Cheatsheet](http://bigocheatsheet.com/ )
* [Wireshark Display Filters](http://media.packetlife.net/media/library/13/Wireshark_Display_Filters.pdf)
* [NYC Tech Talk Series: How Google Backs Up the Internet ](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eNliOm9NtCM)
* [AWS tips](http://wblinks.com/notes/aws-tips-i-wish-id-known-before-i-started/)
* [Linux monitoring tools suggestions](http://aarvik.dk/linux-monitoring-tools-suggestions-from-hacker-news/)
* [Config mgmt utilities ](https://github.com/matthewbarr/config-mgmt-utilities)
* [Everything I Learned About Scaling Online Games I Learned at Google and eBay](http://www.infoq.com/presentations/kixeye-scalability)
* [5 dysfunctions of devops teams](https://www.scriptrock.com/blog/5-dysfunctions-devops-team-absence-trust/)
* [Hardening NodeJS for production](http://blog.argteam.com/coding/hardening-node-js-for-production-part-2-using-nginx-to-avoid-node-js-load/)
* [Technology roadmapping](http://nexightgroup.com/ten-tips-for-successful-technology-roadmapping-part-1/)
* [Create a deb package from scripts or binaries](http://askubuntu.com/questions/27715/create-a-deb-package-from-scripts-or-binaries)
* [Continuous Integration on Infrastructure: Testing ](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mWtJwlv7TtU)
* [Lintian](http://lintian.debian.org/)
* [Effing package managers](https://github.com/jordansissel/fpm)
* [Startups, mad men and missing out](http://zachholman.com/posts/startups-mad-men-and-missing-out/)
* [Stop using Nagios so it can die peacefully ](http://www.slideshare.net/superdupersheep/stop-using-nagios-so-it-can-die-peacefully)
* [Aptly](http://www.aptly.info/)
* [How the guardian sucessfully moved domain](http://www.theguardian.com/info/developer-blog/2014/feb/18/how-the-guardian-successfully-moved-domain)
* [Cluster level orchestration](http://coreos.com/blog/cluster-level-container-orchestration/)

###January 2014
* [What we learnt talking to 60 companies about monitoring](http://blog.dataloop.io/2014/01/30/what-we-learnt-talking-to-60-companies-about-monitoring/)

###2013
* [Automated testing in biology]( http://live.wsj.com/video/this-robot-is-changing-how-we-cure-diseases/C44DAE3D-C7FD-4C87-9E3F-685498A0C2CB.html#!C44DAE3D-C7FD-4C87-9E3F-685498A0C2CB)
* [A million code lines](http://www.informationisbeautiful.net/visualizations/million-lines-of-code/)
* [Bad at entropy](http://www.loper-os.org/bad-at-entropy/manmach.html)
* [Learn to code learn to think](http://www.hilarymason.com/blog/learn-to-code-learn-to-think/)
* [lxc running 14000 tests per day](http://codeascraft.com/2013/09/23/lxc-running-14000-tests-per-day-and-beyond-part-1/)
* [Scale organisations by scalling engineers](http://www.slideshare.net/bcantrill/surge2013)
* [Github repositories of music tech](http://musicmachinery.com/2013/09/02/github-repositories-of-music-tech/)
* [Folly of prediction](http://freakonomics.com/2011/09/14/new-freakonomics-radio-podcast-the-folly-of-prediction/)
* [Lean hypotheses](http://pivotallabs.com/lean-hypotheses/)
* [Top 100 agile books 2013](Phoenix project comes top  http://www.noop.nl/2013/08/top-100-agile-books-edition-2013.html?utm_source=feedburner&utm_medium=feed&utm_campaign=Feed%3A+noop+%28NOOP.NL%29)
* [Toyota method at a non-profit ](http://www.good.is/posts/giving-ideas-not-money-a-new-type-of-corporate-philanthropy)
* [Culture and ethos](https://github.com/bjeanes/culture/blob/master/culture_and_ethos.md)
* [Micro services](http://www.infoq.com/presentations/Micro-Services)
* [Immutable server](http://martinfowler.com/bliki/ImmutableServer.html)
* [You should write ugly code](http://redotheweb.com/2013/06/04/you-should-write-ugly-code.html)
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
